alert.note: Alert for Bracken; Grant; Owen; Pendleton (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 28 at 1:20AM EDT until July 28 at 4:30AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... West Central Bracken County in northern Kentucky... Southeastern Grant County in northern Kentucky... East Central Owen County in northern Kentucky... Southern Pendleton County in northern Kentucky... * Until 430 AM EDT. * At 120 AM EDT, radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flash flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as well as other poor drainage and low-lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Williamstown, Falmouth, Brooksville, Morgan, Corinth, Marcus, Camp Northward, Cordova, Mckinneysburg, Cherry Grove, Browning Corner, Neave, Keefer, Lawrenceville, New Columbus and Powersville. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. To report flash flooding, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
